line_1: Its day oft in sorrow declines,
line_2: Love's morning how blithsome it shines,
With secret ills at home he pines,

line_1: Which low to earth its drooping head declines,
line_2: His face besprent with liquid crystal shines,

line_1: In vain their proffered service she declines,
line_2: Their hateful presence with her loss combines,

line_1: The sainted well, where yon bleak hill declines,
line_2: But now the hill, the river crown'd with pines,
As lone I sit, the half-formed lines

line_1: Where the true Son of Glory ne're declines,
line_2: But with unclouded Vigour always shines.

line_1: And, with her Waning, Lucifer declines.
line_2: The Sickly Moon the Hemisphere resigns;

line_1: Then all the jocund scene declines,
line_2: The drooping tribe in secret pines,

line_1: And, in unclouded slowness, calm declines!
line_2: O greatly bless'd! whose evening sweetest shines,

line_1: The Combatant too late the Field declines;
line_2: When now the Sword is girded to his Loins.
